place_description: Sunflour Baking Company is the Charlotte bakery & cafe you have been looking for! Come visit our five locations to get a taste of our fresh brewed coffee or small batch, homemade pastries and breads.Since 2009, Sunflour Baking Company has been a local favorite in the Noda neighborhood as well as for customers all around Charlotte and beyond. People all over the country order our Cake Jars every day!We invite you to come to visit our local cafes. They are all great spots to hang out, get work done, catch up with friends or enjoy some quiet time. We are sure you will love our bright, friendly interiors and of course our pastry case.

reviews_data.review_text: So I walked in to kill time while I washed clothes to give it a try, I pass it all the time. The lady at the cash register was very friendly. She gave me a recommendation for a drink and it was that was really good. I also ordered a croissant sandwich, so I picked a seat to wait for both. The young lady brought me my drink and told  me my food would be coming out shortly. Again, she was amazing. As I was waiting I played on my phone and then another young lady, with her back turned to me, kind of just dropped my food on the table on the opposite side of me (not in front of me, I came alone). Didn't say "here you go" "can I get you anything else?" And just walked away. I even said "thank you" no reply. " That was really rude to me and felt motivated. Based off that interaction, I will never go back. It's crazy how one little thing can ruin your whole experience.
Rice Krispy treats are out of this world
Great atmosphere! Friendly staff! Love the food
Great little spot. Deserves more of a 4.5 rather than the 3.9 they have.

Absolutely the BEST. Great food made with balanced flavors and passion. Excellent service with clean, well maintained dine-in experience. The breakfast sandwiches are fantastic! The baked goods were fresh & and delicious, and so was the coffee. We will return whenever we are in the area.

Super welcoming and friendly staff. The avocado melt panini is excellent-  I came back and got it two days in a row this week. The almond croissant is also amazing. Great addition to Noda neighborhood!

This place is wonderful! Hands down the best food and the staff is SO kind and accommodating. This place fits right in with the neighborhood.
One aspect I do not appreciate is the same damn playlist everyday. It's dull for us that work from home here and is absolutely tortuous to the daily employees. There are actually studies that show this kind of thing as a torture technique. Do NOT ruin a wonderful place and employee morale over a boring politically correct playlist that slowly chips away at one's soul and kills creativity in general.
Sorry for the rant.
This place rocks.
Download a music app and mix it up.
Y'all this place is so good. I get up early and drive out of my way to get their pastries. I've spent a lot of time in France and their pastries send me right back

My experience here always varies by who is working. Yesterday I came in, and I was first in line and in an empty shop. There was a young lady with short black braids, brown hoodie, who made eye contact with me as she came around the corner, but didn't greet me. She turned around and got a different girl to help me instead...? I know she works the cash register herself because I've seen her before but if it was someone else's responsibility she could have at least greeted me. She didn't even smile or nod. I don't think I'll be coming back, as I didn't feel welcomed and it's been kind of hit or miss when this employee is there anyway.
Awesome bakery!!  Great service, yummy food, coffee drinks and delicious  pastries *

I love their croissants but of the locations we went to, the ones at the Jordan Pl were my least favorite. Something was not quite the same as the best ones are at the 7th Street location. The dough doesn't rise correctly from within and its dense. At 7th, their croissants separate from within. Something is missing from the process.
Everything else was great and I think the coffee is better at this location.

Fantastic group of individuals. Presentation is excellent and quality of goods is fantastic. The atmosphere is pleasant and people can be seen using this as a destination spot. Highly recommend everyone to give it a shot
Delicious sandwich for lunch. Took home some baked goods. Very nice.
Wonderful experience. Amazing food. Extremely friendly staff. Will definitely be back. Thank you!
The absolute rudest woman works here being super rude about having a service animal which I have an ID for. Terrible vibes
Great the best coffee and breakfast sandwiches

Great spot for breakfast sandwiches and burritos! We ordered the breakfast burritio and the forager w/ bacon on sourdough and both were awesome. Staff was super friendly and the inside was nicely setup for takeout and dine in customers.
It nice to find a friendly, outgoing staff when most places barely acknowledge you. Great environment and food.

Been here a few times, never had an amazing experience. First time, the pastries were super dry and not great. They also lean on the not very sweet side. Which is fine, but when they're not fresh, it's awful.

This most recent time I went, it was early on a Saturday, but it wasn't super busy. I waited a half hour for one breakfast sandwich and a cinnamon roll. The lady at the counter(who was super sweet) told me they'd bring it all out to me, cinnamon roll included. Though, they did not bring it out and when I asked, turns out they had run out in that time. I instead got a scone and I'm not being dramatic, it was one of the worst things I've ever tried. Bitter, dry, hard as a rock!!

I know a lot of people rave about it, and the staff are super friendly,  but I have not had much luck :(

This location used to be good but one Saturday I came and waited 45 minutes for a simple breakfast sandwich and coffee. Others had similar experiences that day. Then today I ordered ahead and it is not busy whatsoever and they still got the order wrong. Just unacceptable and not worth $10 for a breakfast sandwich that you have to wait to get for 45 minutes or in another case the completely wrong sandwich.
Club sandwich is great!!!

The cinnamon rolls were gone by 11am. Went with a snickerdoodle muffin and it was hard and dry but the flavor was good. Not sure if they can warm them up but they didn't ask. My hot chocolate was great. The staff were friendly, although I wish they were more interactive and gave suggestions like other coffee places especially since this was my first visit.
I loved the dining area but all the seats had crumbs and others didn't appear that staff walks through to wipe down tables in between customers.
Parking was difficult to find. I'd like to try one more time to see how I really feel about this place, hopefully next time is a 5 start experience but I don't know.
If you like rude employees, and waiting 20 minutes for a simple breakfast sandwich this is the place for you. 50 cents extra to add spinach (see photo)

My experience was nothing short of excellent. I went at 845am on a Monday and the staff was phenomenal. I was greeted as soon as I walked in, everyone seemed to be in a great mood and my food and coffee were ready in under 10 minutes. If nothing else, I'll go back simply for the service. The young woman at the counter with the braids had the most bubbly personality and I loved it. The croissants and vanilla sugar roll are a must try.
No chocolate croissants left at 11am. Egg is not real egg, should be an option for made to order egg instead of a sheet of pre cooked egg. Muffins are dense and not fully cooked in the center
Regardless of what location you choose expect a 20-30 minute wait for your food.

We have visited this location multiple times and like always, the food was great, but they need to train their staff better. We were getting pastries from the day old basket, we asked the employee what the pastry was, she didn't know and didn't even bother asking anyone else. This is not the first time this has happened, we recognize that customer service is not what once was, however, is good practice for employees to treat customers with courtesy and good manners. Little things like greeting customers and saying thank you, is just good business.

After hearing so many positive comments about the bakery, it was a huge disappointment this morning. I'm not sure if the staff was new or just frankly didn't care about being there but when you order a beautiful croissant and ask for it lightly toasted and it comes back split and smashed, my heart was left smashed like the croissant.  This was a huge insult to such a beautiful croissant! You start to wonder if the staff knows what they're doing with pastry. The scone was not even properly wrapped, but shoved into a bag instead of placed into a box. So instead of enjoying the glaze ON our scone we were just trying to get the scone out of the bag without losing all of the delicious glaze. People!!! Figure out how to properly wrap and prepare fresh beautiful pastries. And unless someone is ordering a croissant for a sandwich, NEVER SPLIT IT AND PUT IT ON A PANINI PRESS!

I love the Elizabeth location and was excited to see they opened in the NoDa area that's closer to my house.
I just had a great BLT sandwich. I came to see if I could get a loaf of bread, but they only sell them at the Elizabeth location.

1. Please consider selling loaves at this location!!
2. Change your hours sign to reflect actual hours. It's 7:30 pm on a Saturday and while I was eating I saw at least two groups of people that wanted to come in but didn't try the door because the sign says you close at 4 pm.

Isabel was so welcoming and sweet when I came in this morning. Even with me being in a rush she was so patient and kind and even recommended me getting a pumpkin muffin which was so good. Definitely coming back!!
Large selection of gluten free options and I always pre-order large orders. The service is always good and the goodies are always fresh and ready on time.
Ordered on line via Uber eats and the restaurant never had my food ready when drivers got there.

I visit this location pretty often for breakfast and lunch, my last visit I was greeted by Teresa and she was amazing! From her informing me of the point system that I wasn't familiar with to her recommending the BEST chicken salad I've had in a while. She was very sweet and helpful I had an overall great experience, and I can't wait to pop back in.

Six staff members behind the counter sipping coffee, chatting and ignoring customers. Once I was finally helped (5 mins of staring at the staff waiting). Girl took my order, it was wrong and they were out of items. Overall I felt like I was bothering and unconvincing the staff, not a great way to make paying customers feel.

I love Subflour and have been a custom for 15  plus years but this location was very disappointing. I would recommend better management and training for the staff.

Waited 45 minutes for order. Staff was absolutely 0 help. It would've been easier for me to go into the kitchen and make the sandwich myself. Sad to see this brand has gone so down hill, this was my final straw.
I love this place a lot.. I would like if this shop is opened in Edison NJ
NODA pastries!

The sandwich was trash honestly. It wasn't even hot and I waited for like 20 mins and it was maybe 4 customers inside. The mimosa was decent, I got an iced Americano and the barista used piping hot water so I ended up with a hot americano instead. I think asked for a cold brew and they were out so I got the nitro which was mid.

The lady greets with a smile I'm sorry I don't know her name but she's super sweet and kind. She's also efficient and even suggests to try the sample zucchini brownie. Very good experience would recommend definitely .
Delicious food, great coffee, and service is great. Thank you, Kemi! You rock!

Sunflour Bakery in Noda has the best staff, food and drinks! Teresa always has a smile on her face and is a whole vibe and a half, she truly makes the experience! She is super helpful and goes above and beyond to make customers feel welcome. Get that girl a raise, you can't afford to lose her

Absolutely love Sunflower Baking Company!! The food and drinks are always delicious and the service is always so great! Mark and Theresa were so helpful and nice when I went in last! If you haven't been yet, you're definitely missing out!!

Waited almost 30 minutes for a cold brew with oat milk when there were maybe 3 or 4 people ahead of me, but no big deal - I wasn't in a rush. The barista seemed really flustered, behind, and confused so maybe she was new, totally understandable. The man running the register turned back to help her make drinks. A customer went back up to the counter with a drink that he had already drank out of and asked to have caramel added because his drink was wrong. The guy helping the barista took a spoon, put it into the caramel bottle to scrape the caramel out, put it in the customer's used cup to stir it and then put it BACK in the caramel container. I thought surely, they would be taking this back to the dish pit. Nope. They then proceeded to continue using that same caramel for other customer's drinks. If that's what they're doing right in front of customers, I can only imagine what goes on in the kitchen. Super disappointing and gross experience.
Nothing at this place tastes good. I'm a fool for trying them multiple times. Super lazy staff, took over 40 minutes to make an avocado toast with a completely empty store.

I am overjoyed to have multiple locations of this AMAZING bakery in the neighborhood.  I was crestfallen after my favorite local bakery closed (RIP Lincoln's) and trying two allegedly French well-known bakeries in the area that make mediocre pastries at best.
I had heard about Sunflour for a long time and after finally trying it, I am blown away.  The almond croissant is THE best almond croissant I've ever had in the US and on par with what I've had in France.  The cherry danish was outstanding.  The chocolate croissant is PRECISELY how it's supposed to be: buttery, flaky, and the perfect inclusion of dark chocolate that is not overwhelmingly sweet.  The pistachio macaron was delicious, delicate and not hard (like at one of the aforementioned establishments).  Today I tried their soup of the day which was potato and ham, absolutely delicious.  Their coffee drinks are always perfect.  Every location I've been to is clean, has great music, and the staff is very friendly and attentive.  I highly recommend you try this place.
The food was absolutely amazing it always is

Really surprised by the negative reviews here. I've now been to this location several times since it opened, even brought friends & family here, and every time we have been impressed by the pastries, coffee and entrees. Service has always been on point and staff is extremely nice and inviting. This is not a fast food joint, nor should it be, so don't expect your food in 5 mins or less--that said, I've never waited more than 10-15 mins and I've been at peak morning hours. This place is great and we need more spots like it in the neighborhood.
I liked burrito and coffeeeee
The service has been terrible every time I've been in this place. I wouldn't come if you have somewhere to be.
Really nice neighborhood spot for lunch. Spacious, plenty of seating, and good service. Kid friendly; high chairs available and changing tables in the bathrooms.
Great service, coffee, and pastries. Did not try the sandwiches as they did not have gluten-free bread.

I love the atmosphere, the service, and coffee is pretty good. I enjoyed the sandwiches as well. Not sure where the bad reviews coming from? People make mistakes, that's life. The main thing is that the food is good and service is super friendly. Not crowded either. I will definitely be a regular here
Food from the counter is good.  The ham and gruyere was pretty skimpy and sad

Love the vibes in here! The music is easy to listen to if you like to work from cafes. There are a lot of GF and vegan options in the baked goods fridge! The coffee and tea is also amazing!!

There's free parking in the garage and on the street!
Excellent pastries, coffee, and service

I had the best experience here! The person taking my order was incredibly patient with me while I stumbled over ordering breakfast for my partner and I, to start- i am an anxious person. This person was also incredibly helpful and patient with another customer, and followed all health protocol SUPER well. I am not sure of their name but they deserve employee of the month for SURE. They also made a delicious latte and gave a tea recommendation that my partner says is her new favorite!! 10/5 stars for that employee!
A walk from our townhome. Love the vibe
This may be the worst location in charlotte unfortunately. Today made the 3rd straight time that something was wrong with my order. Will not be returning to this location any time soon.
I was really disappointed with the customer service. The food was average, but it is a super cute set up there.
Great location, ambiance, service, and food & drink

We love Sunflour Baking Company and have been to several different locations. This one has one of the neatest atmospheres. The food is always wonderful. My issue is with the knowledge and willingness of staff to get ingredients. I have some very specific and unusual food allergies that cannot be answered with their little sign, so I always ask. The person at the register seemed bothered by my asking and after the third "I think it has..." I asked her to get someone that knew or show me an ingredient list. With so many people having food allergies, unfortunately, I would think there would be consideration given to give someone information regarding their own product. If you don't have any allergies, this is a good place to go.

Moving to an apartment in this area and checked it out to see what is close by to my future home! Place was very clean and new - tons of options. I had a breakfast burrito and a coffee. I will definitely be a regular once I officially move in! I know it is new, so maybe that is why the reviews are a bit mixed, but I hope it all works out!

This is the second time my requests were not followed. I ordered a breakfast burrito with no jalapenos, allergic to them. I get home, what do I have on the burrito, yup, jalapenos. Today, I ordered a warm cheese biscuit. Is it warm, nope! She took it in the back and acted like she warmed it up. These workers wonder why people won't tip!
Waited for 15 mins on a grilled cheese that they didn't send to the kitchen so I waited another 15 mins to get the grilled cheese that didn't have tomatoes and was on the wrong bread
Great addition to the neighborhood.  Awesome breakfast & lunch selections with a killer bakery.

All other locations (except Ballantyne. I havent been) would place 'day old' pastries to the side and not mix them with the fresh pastries. I ordered 2 Morning Glory muffins and they were clearly stale. The company and service is great but this location needs to maintain the quality this company is known for. This place needs extra management before they lose control over quality.
good priced food, servers are nice, atmosphere was great. I got sourdough blt and a vanilla sugar pastry. super good all around

This place has really good food, I think they just need to work out the kinks.

It doesn't seem like I should be waiting 15+ minutes for a breakfast sandwich on a weekday when no one's there.

Food is good, but the service is just inexcusable. They made a mistake with my order and refused to remake it or give  me a refund and just let it sit for pickup all day. It's a nice place but because of the service I will never go back to this location, they just don't care about the company or the customer. I still have the order number and information if management would like to make this correct.

I've passed by this place so often and finally got a chance to visit today. The people behind the counter were welcoming and super patient as we took some time perusing the menu. I ordered a Cortada, French onion and bacon panini on rosemary sourdough, and a berry croissant. My husband got a nitro cold brew and an egg, sausage, cheddar on a cheddar biscuit. We decided to stay in and eat as there is plenty of seating. Everything tasted delicious and fresh. Can't wait to come back!

The blonde seemed annoyed when I walked in after ordering a breakfast sandwich online 10 minutes before and asking about it (just wanted to make sure it wasn't behind the counter, I wasn't even expecting it to be ready), and then they held it 45 minutes. Didn't even tell me there was a pickup counter or call my name or anything. Actually shocked at this. It was not crowded either, and probably won't ever be with this service.

The egg and bacon bowl I ordered was an odd rectangular shape and sadly devoid of all flavor. I assume it was microwaved. If you have celiac disease or are gluten free, make sure to request your pastries in separate packaging. My gluten free cookie was placed in the same bag as my girlfriend's biscuit without a divider so cross-contamination is highly likely.
